title.narrative: Provision of emergency life saving emergency WASH and protection services to severely drought-affected families in Ghor Province

description.narrative: Using a multi-sector approach the project targets severely drought-affected populations. The project entails 2 components including 1. WASH assistance and 2. protection assistance in Dawlatyar, Lal Wa Sarjangal and Tolak districts of Ghor province. The project is based on rigorous needs assessments performed directly by CRDSA technical teams (in coordination with provincial ANDMAs and DRRD) and FAO's Rapid Assessment of the 2018 Winter Dry Spell in Afghanistan (April 2018), iMMAP amp FEWSNET (April 2018) and updates from the Early Warning Information Group (May 2018). In the component 1.emergency WASH assistance will provide safe drinking water and hygiene promotion sessions to 31500 people (4500 drought affected families - 7875 men, 5985 women, 9135 boys and 8505 girls) in Ghor province in Dawlatyar district (1800 families [12600 people] in Pitab Shiba, Til Bi Nazar, Loka Mazar, Ganda Ab, Garayha, Shar Shar Ulia, and Tilak Dah marda villages), Lal Wa Sarjangal district (1280 families [8960 people] in Kansalto Kerman, barsh tugak, Chal Payan, Nazeran Dahan now Ghaiagh, Deh Pitab, and Kola Shafabig villages) and Tolak district of Ghor province (1500 families [10500 people] in Sar Chahar Ra, Jawaja, Droodi, Kabootarkhana, Khaje Sin, and Ghar Mana villages). In all of the three targets districts safe drinking water will be provided through constructing 60 hand-dug water wells (20 wells in Dawlatyar district, 20 wells in Lal Wa Sarjangal and 20 wells in Tolak district). In addition, 2 water piped schemes will be repaired in Dawlatyar district. Additionally, hygiene promotion sessions will be provided to 9000 individuals (2 individuals from each 0f 4500 target families). Of these, each of 500 IDP families will also receive one hygiene kit. In component 2. Protection assistance consists of two sub-components namely GBV prevention/response and child protection which will be implemented in the same target areas of WASH component. The GBV prevention and response will focus on provision of awareness regarding GBV and its prevention to 9000 individuals (male and female), and identification of 340 GBV survivors and providing case management services (psychosocial counselling and referral to specialized health, legal and safety services) to them. The child protection sub-component will provides positive parenthood skills awareness raising for 9000 parents, and providing child-friendly spaces to 1000 children to minimize the effects of the emergency on their psychosocial well-being and development.
